content: Please answer the thread in which was the original question so I can get some context. Thunderbird has loads of toggles.
creator: frisée

content:
If you are running Windows, please, as a diagnostic, start the Operating System in Safe Mode with Networking privileges and see if the problem persists.

If the problem is resolved, there is likely to be a conflict between TB and another piece of software. By launching background software one by one, it should be seen what the conflict is with.

Most of these issues seem to be associated with Third Party anti-virus software so turning that on first if you use it would be the way to go.
creator: frisée

content: You don't need to uninstall to get the latest upgrade. You go to Help/About Thunderbird in the program. Thunderbird will allow free downloads. You do not have to pay to get a download. The Official Download page is here - https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/
creator: frisée

content: You are at least the fourth Optus customer having this problem - see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1486768. No solution seems to have been found, yet.
creator: frisée

content: Is this an IMAP or POP account? Are you running Thunderbird on a computer, Mobile, Tablet or something else (please specify)? Which version of Thunderbird are you using? Which Operating System are you using?
creator: frisée

content: Open the Quick Filters (Top Right) and use the 'Show only unread messages' icon/toggle
creator: frisée

content:
"Your draft message was not copied to your drafts folder (Drafts) due to network or file access errors."

This isn't a certificate error. Why do you think your email provider has an invalid certificate?

Annoyingly, it also seems to prevent me saving the message I just wrote into the Drafts folder.

As a workaround you can select the Drafts folder underneath the Local Folders account as Drafts folder for your IMAP account. Check your Account Settings - Copies & Folders.
creator: christ1
